entry.tran: 令人遗憾的;可惜的;令人惋惜的
entry.def: You describe something as regrettable when you think that it is bad and that it should not happen or have happened.

example.ex: ...an investigation into what the army described as a regrettable incident...
example.tran: 对军方称之为令人遗憾的事件的调查

example.ex: It is regrettable that strike leaders seem intent on spoiling holidays.
example.tran: 遗憾的是罢工领导人似乎决意要破坏节日的气氛。

sentences.sentence: "it's regrettable that she didn't go to college"
"it's too bad he had no feeling himself for church"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 后悔的, 抱歉的, 惋惜的, 遗憾的
stems_affixes.word_buile: regret[n.&v. 遗憾,懊悔,抱歉]+ful……的→regretful后悔的, 抱歉的
regret[n.&v. 遗憾,懊悔,抱歉]+able……的→regrettable可叹的;可惜的
re回+gret问候,迎接,悲泣→n.&v. 遗憾,懊悔,抱歉
